explanation: The elif line only checked A==B-1 or A==B-3, which detects adjacency only when A < B (it effectively tests B == A+1 or B == A+3). That misses the symmetric cases where B < A (e.g. A=4, B=3). I replaced that line with a check using absolute difference (abs(A-B)==1 or abs(A-B)==3) so adjacency is detected in both directions while keeping the existing wrap-around exclusion (the first if) unchanged.
